title: Bug 110566 - Wrong data set result returned when setting an invalid filter expression for row[0]
description: When setting a filter, like 'row[0] equals to 0', or when returning a null result set, the data set returns the wrong result. The expected behavior is that an invalid filter expression for row[0] should not return any result.
OB: The bug causes the data set to return the first result record even when the filter is set to an invalid expression.
EB: The expected behavior is that row[0] can only be generated after fetching all the data, and it should not be used as a filter expression.
SR:
To reproduce the bug:
1. Set a filter in the data set using 'row[0] equals to'
2. Click on the 'Preview' tab

Expected result: The data set should not return any result.
